entry.summary: The email thread on bitcoin-dev mailing list dated March 17, 2021, discussed the usage and development of Bitcoin Core in non-English speaking parts of the world. The thread started with Ryan Grant acknowledging the new clarifications made by those who responded to his earlier query about taproot QC mitigations that he had missed. It enables users to send, receive, and store bitcoins securely. The development of Bitcoin Core involves contributions from developers worldwide who work together to improve the software's performance, security, and usability. The software is available in multiple languages, including Chinese, Spanish, French, German, Japanese, Korean, Russian, and more.Bitcoin has gained popularity worldwide, with many countries adopting it as a legal tender or recognizing it as a form of payment. However, the level of adoption and usage varies across different regions. Some countries, such as Japan and South Korea, have a high level of adoption, while others, such as Africa and Latin America, are still catching up.In conclusion, the email thread on bitcoin-dev mailing list highlights the importance of understanding how people in non-English speaking regions use and develop Bitcoin Core.
